oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Union Bank and Trust Co. building, Nashville, Tenn., circa 1910
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of the Union Bank and Trust Company building, located in downtown Nashville, Tennessee at 225 Third Avenue, North. The bank was organized circa the 1880s. Leslie Cheek was elected president circa 1909, succeeding Edgar Jones. In 1911 the American National Bank absorbed Union Bank and Trust Company in a consolidation merger. Forms part of the Nashville Room Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Union Bank and Trust Company (Nashville, Tenn.)
